title: Ashe's Ult Arrow
body: On a number of occasions I've been hit by Ashe's Ult arrow when graphically I shouldn't have and it's really starting to annoy me to no end. I understand there's a Splash for Slow, but I always end up getting stunned instead when I'm graphically far from the actual arrow itself. Please either update the graphic to match the actual hit box of the arrow, or shrink the hit box to match the arrow's size.

replies.body: [Meanwhile...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tqm6z8nYMzk)

Happened on Sp4zie's stream too.  It's really annoying.  His teammate said it looked like it missed on his screen, but the fact that two people see different things is not good and should be fixed.  No matter what the actual glitch is, Riot really needs to address it.  

Video starts a few seconds before the glitch:  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xnBznOuAeL4&t=3m15s

I was thinking it was related to this bug, as well.  Sometimes the shooter sees it hit but it actually didn't, and I guess the inverse is also true (sometimes the victim sees it miss but it actually hits).

"I'll poke the team myself, but from having worked with them before, the hitboxes are sized and placed properly (though I can understand your confusion, especially as a player who doesnt' have access to behind-the-scenes info)."

EDIT: Now that I think about it though, I guess this doesn't really address the fact that the hitboxes _functionality_ is broken too, but then Riot doesn't like to talk about the many bugs that ruin their game. They really like to pretend it's stable, probably for E-Sports sake (even though fixing it would help there).
